title: Are Fact-Checkers Really Checking Facts, Or Telling You What to believe?
body:
[![](https://substackcdn.com/image/fetch/$s_!LyEk!,f_auto,q_auto:good,fl_progressive:steep/https%3A%2F%2Fsubstack-post-media.s3.amazonaws.com%2Fpublic%2Fimages%2F7ba4f8dc-f0fa-4ddc-88e9-81abeddaa5d9_1344x768.heic)](https://substackcdn.com/image/fetch/$s_!LyEk!,f_auto,q_auto:good,fl_progressive:steep/https%3A%2F%2Fsubstack-post-media.s3.amazonaws.com%2Fpublic%2Fimages%2F7ba4f8dc-f0fa-4ddc-88e9-81abeddaa5d9_1344x768.heic)

**The New Inquisition: How NATOâ€™s â€œFact-Checkersâ€ Became Cognitive Warfare Units**

Have you noticed how almost every time you question a mainstream story online, a â€œfact-checkâ€ suddenly appears to tell you what to think? It feels reassuring â€” until you realize whoâ€™s behind it. These fact-checkers arenâ€™t neutral referees; theyâ€™re **embedded in NATOâ€™s cognitive warfare strategy**, a program designed not to protect you from lies, but to _manage what you believe_. Their real job is to keep Western publics â€” you and me â€” in psychological alignment with NATOâ€™s wars, its enemies, and its worldview. When they label dissent as â€œdisinformation,â€ theyâ€™re not correcting mistakes; theyâ€™re policing the boundaries of acceptable thought. Itâ€™s a quiet, civilized kind of propaganda â€” one that doesnâ€™t shout, but whispers, _â€œTrust us. Donâ€™t ask too many questions.â€_ And thatâ€™s what makes it so dangerous: because the moment you stop questioning, theyâ€™ve already won.

**Executive Summary**

Western **â€œfact-checkingâ€ institutions** â€“ including the EUâ€™s **East StratCom Task Force (EUvsDisinfo)**, the Atlantic Councilâ€™s **Digital Forensic Research Lab (DFRLab)**, and related outlets like **Bellingcat** â€“ have evolved into integral components of NATOâ€™s **cognitive warfare** apparatus. Ostensibly created after 2014 to counter â€œdisinformation,â€ these bodies operate under the _political mandates and funding of Western governments and military alliances_, blurring lines between truth-seeking and information warfare. In this exposÃ© I will show that:

**Institutional Genesis & Oversight**

EUvsDisinfo was established in 2015 under the EU External Action Service explicitly to â€œ_address Russiaâ€™s ongoing disinformation campaigns_â€ [eeas.europa.eu](https://www.eeas.europa.eu/eeas/questions-and-answers-about-east-stratcom-task-force_en#:~:text=Why%20and%20when%20was%20the,East%20StratCom%20Task%20Force%20created), falling under EU foreign policy supervision. DFRLab was incubated at the NATO-aligned Atlantic Council in 2016 as an open-source investigation team, later boosted by partnerships with Big Tech and Western governments [en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Atlantic_Council#:~:text=The%20Digital%20Forensic%20Research%20Lab,19) [wired.com](https://www.wired.com/story/facebook-enlists-dfrlab-track-trolls/#:~:text=That%20combination%20has%20helped%20the,among%20the%20organization%27s%20biggest%20sponsors). Nominally independent outlets like Bellingcat also receive substantial grants from state-backed entities (e.g. the US **National Endowment for Democracy** and the EU) [euvsdisinfo.eu](https://euvsdisinfo.eu/report/bellingcat-is-a-false-investigative-site-backed-by-western-intelligence-aimed-to-whitewash-terrorists-in-syria/#:~:text=terrorists%20and%20attack%20the%20Syrian,regime). Thus, many fact-checkers are directly **financed or steered by NATO/EU institutions or their proxies**, embedding them in the state security structure.

**Cognitive Warfare Doctrine**

NATOâ€™s own concept development has increasingly treated **â€œthe human domainâ€ â€“ civilian minds and perceptions â€“ as a battleground**. In 2020, NATOâ€™s Innovation Hub urged recognition of the _â€œrenewed importance of the sixth operational domain, namely the Human Domain,â€_ since all military actions ultimately seek to _â€œimpose a desired behaviour on a chosen audienceâ€_[innovationhub-act.org](https://innovationhub-act.org/wp-content/uploads/2023/12/20210122_CW-Final.pdf#:~:text=a%20desired%20be%02haviour%20on%20a,2020%20Page%204%20of%2045). NATO documents describe _â€œthe brain as both the target and the weaponâ€_ in conflicts over information and belief [act.nato.int](https://www.act.nato.int/activities/cognitive-warfare/#:~:text=NORFOLK%2C%20VA%20%E2%80%93%C2%A0Cognitive%20warfare%20is,maintain%20and%20protect%20cognitive%20advantage). This doctrine of **cognitive warfare** explicitly blurs military operations into the political and societal sphere: _â€œAny user of modern information technologies is a potential target. It targets the whole of a nationâ€™s human capital.â€_ [innovationhub-act.org](https://innovationhub-act.org/wp-content/uploads/2023/12/20210122_CW-Final.pdf#:~:text=applied%20to%20the%20political%2C%20economic%2C,%E2%80%A6%29%20Indeed). Fact-checking units are thus not neutral arbiters of truth, but **active participants in strategic influence campaigns**, aligned with NATO objectives to _â€œweakenâ€ adversarial narratives and shape public opinion_ as a matter of security [act.nato.int](https://www.act.nato.int/activities/cognitive-warfare/#:~:text=Cognitive%20Warfare%20focuses%20on%20attacking,often%20involve%20both%20offensive%20and).

**Funding & Networks**

These organizations form a **dense publicâ€“private network** fueled by government contracts, defense alliances, and Big Tech money. The EUâ€™s East StratCom Task Force (which runs EUvsDisinfo) was initially small and underfunded, but by 2019â€“2020 it scaled up with millions in EU budget (growing to â‚¬3â€“4 million/year and 16 staff) [eeas.europa.eu](https://www.eeas.europa.eu/eeas/questions-and-answers-about-east-stratcom-task-force_en#:~:text=strategic%20communications,1%20million) [cepa.org](https://cepa.org/comprehensive-reports/democratic-offense-against-disinformation/#:~:text=,seconded%20from%20EU%20member%20states). The DFRLab, part of a Washington think tank whose top donors include the U.S. State Department and UK government, received a **$1 million Facebook grant in 2018** and became an official â€œpartnerâ€ to Facebook for election integrity [en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Atlantic_Council#:~:text=The%20Digital%20Forensic%20Research%20Lab,19) [wired.com](https://www.wired.com/story/facebook-enlists-dfrlab-track-trolls/#:~:text=That%20combination%20has%20helped%20the,among%20the%20organization%27s%20biggest%20sponsors). Bellingcat, despite claims of independence, openly lists funding from the NED (a U.S. Congress-funded â€œdemocracy promotionâ€ vehicle long used to do CIA-type influence work in the open [declassifieduk.org](https://www.declassifieduk.org/cia-sidekick-gives-2-6m-to-uk-media-groups/#:~:text=The%20NED%20was%20%E2%80%9Ccreated%E2%80%A6to%20do,%E2%80%9D) [declassifieduk.org](https://www.declassifieduk.org/cia-sidekick-gives-2-6m-to-uk-media-groups/#:~:text=Allen%20Weinstein%2C%20the%20director%20of,%E2%80%9D)) and from EU bodies [euvsdisinfo.eu](https://euvsdisinfo.eu/report/bellingcat-is-a-false-investigative-site-backed-by-western-intelligence-aimed-to-whitewash-terrorists-in-syria/#:~:text=terrorists%20and%20attack%20the%20Syrian,regime). Other firms like **Graphika** and **Moonshot CVE** â€“ often hired by the U.S. GEC (Global Engagement Center) or UK to monitor â€œextremismâ€ â€“ are part of the same ecosystem. Interlocking personnel are common: DFRLabâ€™s director is a former NSC staffer [wired.com](https://www.wired.com/story/facebook-enlists-dfrlab-track-trolls/#:~:text=The%20lab%20got%20its%20start,to%20continue%20denying%20their%20involvement), Atlantic Council boards feature ex-NATO and CIA chiefs [wired.com](https://www.wired.com/story/facebook-enlists-dfrlab-track-trolls/#:~:text=According%20to%20Katie%20Harbath%2C%20Facebook%E2%80%99s,Bush%2C%20was%20an%20added%20bonus), and â€œanti-disinformationâ€ forums often bring these actors together. **Public-private partnerships** abound: e.g. DFRLab coordinates with Meta on takedowns [wired.com](https://www.wired.com/story/facebook-enlists-dfrlab-track-trolls/#:~:text=DFRLab%20is%20a%20scrappier%2C%20substantially,and%20eager%20to%20establish%20its), the BBC-led **Trusted News Initiative** pools mainstream media and Big Tech in a censorship pact, and EUâ€™s Rapid Alert System on disinfo links government agencies with platforms and the NATO StratCom unit [eeas.europa.eu](https://www.eeas.europa.eu/eeas/questions-and-answers-about-east-stratcom-task-force_en#:~:text=The%20Rapid%20Alert%20System%20on,Rapid%20Response%20Mechanism%20and%20NATO) [consilium.europa.eu](https://www.consilium.europa.eu/media/44451/200616-progress-report-nr5-eu-nato-eng.pdf#:~:text=Cooperation%20between%20the%20EU%E2%80%99s%20Rapid,The%20Task%20Force). Money flows from the **U.S. State Departmentâ€™s GEC, NATO and EU grants, NED, and even George Sorosâ€™s Open Society Foundations** into this network, effectively creating a _NATO-funded media proxy_. Notably, a 2022 investigation showed the NED pumped over Â£2.6 million into UK-based media and â€œfact-checkâ€ groups like Bellingcat from 2016â€“2021 [declassifieduk.org](https://www.declassifieduk.org/cia-sidekick-gives-2-6m-to-uk-media-groups/#:~:text=,%E2%80%9Cvehicle%E2%80%9D%20for%20US%20government%20%E2%80%9Cpropaganda%E2%80%9D) â€“ a practice a former CIA officer likened to **using the NED as the CIAâ€™s â€œsidekickâ€ to conduct influence operations overtly** [declassifieduk.org](https://www.declassifieduk.org/cia-sidekick-gives-2-6m-to-uk-media-groups/#:~:text=1980s%2C%20it%20did%20openly%20what,had%20once%20been%20unspeakably%20covert%E2%80%9D).

**Operational Modus Operandi**

Analyzing their output reveals **recurring narrative and linguistic patterns** that align with information warfare goals. EUvsDisinfo in particular employs a repetitive templating of language: any claim diverging from pro-NATO positions is reflexively branded _â€œa recurring pro-Kremlin disinformation narrativeâ€_, a phrase appearing in **over 3,000 instances (1 in 4 sentences) of their database** [cees-roele.medium.com](https://cees-roele.medium.com/exploring-disinformation-at-euvsdisinfo-6cec6c7f05e2#:~:text=Number%20of%20occurrences%20of%20noun,chunks). Content is often introduced with pejorative framing â€“ e.g. calling the target claim â€œbaseless,â€ â€œconspiracy theory,â€ or â€œpro-Russian talking pointâ€ â€“ before offering any factual refutation. By **defining the epistemic boundaries**, they preemptively delegitimize alternative viewpoints. Frequently, the â€œfact-checksâ€ consist of moral condemnation or ridicule rather than objective debunking. For example, when the investigative site Grayzone exposed Bellingcatâ€™s Western intelligence funding, EUvsDisinfo responded not by disproving this (in fact it conceded Bellingcat _â€œis funded by the NED and EU among many other sourcesâ€_) but by asserting the claim _â€œaims to discreditâ€_ a reputable outlet [euvsdisinfo.eu](https://euvsdisinfo.eu/report/bellingcat-is-a-false-investigative-site-backed-by-western-intelligence-aimed-to-whitewash-terrorists-in-syria/#:~:text=terrorists%20and%20attack%20the%20Syrian,regime). The message: **donâ€™t trust the critics**, trust us. This pattern â€“ labeling inconvenient facts as â€œdisinformationâ€ emanating from malign actors â€“ serves to inoculate the public against stories that undermine official narratives.

**Credibility & Truth Concerns**

There are documented cases where these fact-checkers **mislabelled factual information as false**, resulting in censorship or reputational harm to truth-tellers. In early 2018, EUvsDisinfo infamously _blacklisted three mainstream Dutch media outlets as â€œfake newsâ€ sources_, because their reports on issues like the MH17 crash didnâ€™t align neatly with the official line [dutchnews.nl](https://www.dutchnews.nl/2018/02/dutch-media-outlets-take-eu-to-court-over-disinformation-claims/#:~:text=Three%20Dutch%20media%20companies%20are,them%20spreaders%20of%20fake%20news). The Dutch outlets had to sue the EU, leading to a quiet removal of the defamatory entries and an embarrassed admission of error [euvsdisinfo.eu](https://euvsdisinfo.eu/removal-of-three-cases-further-to-complaints-by-dutch-media/#:~:text=Following%20a%20detailed%20review%20of,the%20measures%20set%20out%20below). The Atlantic Councilâ€™s DFRLab also overstepped in its zeal: in 2021 it provided Twitter with a **list of 40,000 accounts** supposedly involved in an â€œIndian disinformation networkâ€ â€“ **Twitterâ€™s internal review found almost all of them were real, legitimate users**, not bots [medium.com](https://medium.com/dfrlab/the-dfrlab-responds-to-twitter-files-story-ec19222b09af#:~:text=Taibbi%20reports%20that%20DFRLab%20contacted,accounts%20to%20be%20authentic%20users). (DFRLabâ€™s analysts had based the list on dubious outside data and, tellingly, Twitter did _not_ suspend those users.) Such overreach illustrates how easily â€œdisinfoâ€ policing slides into **censoring truthful speech or politically inconvenient voices**. Other examples abound: COVID-19 lab-leak theories and the Hunter Biden laptop story were dismissed as â€œdisinformationâ€ by this establishment network â€“ only to later gain validation, illustrating how **todayâ€™s â€œfake newsâ€ can become tomorrowâ€™s fact** once political winds shift. Yet the **â€œcognitive securityâ€ complex** rarely issues mea culpas, since admitting error would undercut their claimed authority over truth.

**Psychological and Behavioral Framework**

NATO and allied governments explicitly deploy **psychological influence techniques** under the banner of fighting disinformation. Internal studies and training from NATOâ€™s StratCom Centre of Excellence delve into **inoculation theory, â€œprebunkingâ€ and â€œnudgeâ€ techniques** to _â€œimmunizeâ€ target audiences against ideas deemed false_ [researchgate.net](https://www.researchgate.net/publication/355809185_INOCULATION_THEORY_AND_MISINFORMATION_Published_by_the_NATO_Strategic_Communications_Centre_of_Excellence#:~:text=INOCULATION%20THEORY%20AND%20MISINFORMATION%20Published,the%20mitigation%20of%20online%20misinformation) [misinforeview.hks.harvard.edu](https://misinforeview.hks.harvard.edu/article/global-vaccination-badnews/#:~:text=Prebunking%20interventions%20based%20on%20%E2%80%9Cinoculation%E2%80%9D,Journal%20of%20Cognition). In practice, this means proactively planting counter-narratives and _emotional framing_ before the â€œenemyâ€ can speak â€“ a strategy lifted straight from social psychology. For instance, â€œ**prebunking**â€ initiatives (often in the form of online games or public service ads) expose people to weakened doses of â€œfake newsâ€ tropes to build resistance [nature.com](https://www.nature.com/articles/s41599-019-0279-9#:~:text=Fake%20news%20game%20confers%20psychological,strategies%20used%20in%20the). **Nudge theory** â€“ subtly steering user behavior (like prompting social media users to read _authoritative sources_ or warning them before sharing â€œunverifiedâ€ content) â€“ is another tool to condition public perception without users realizing the manipulation. **Neuropolitics** has entered the lexicon: NATO researchers talk about **â€œhacking the brainâ€** and â€œ**cognitive security**â€ as the new frontier [resiliencemedia.co](https://www.resiliencemedia.co/p/guest-post-why-the-authoritarian#:~:text=Guest%20Post%3A%20Why%20the%20Authoritarian,term) [polytechnique-insights.com](https://www.polytechnique-insights.com/en/columns/geopolitics/cognitive-warfare-the-new-battlefield-exploiting-our-brains/#:~:text=Cognitive%20warfare%3A%20the%20new%20battlefield,such%20as%20propaganda%20and%20disinformation). Scholarly work tied to NATO innovation hubs frankly describes **â€œexploiting vulnerabilitiesâ€ in human cognition** and emotions to induce desired outcomes [act.nato.int](https://www.act.nato.int/activities/cognitive-warfare/#:~:text=Cognitive%20Warfare%20focuses%20on%20attacking,often%20involve%20both%20offensive%20and). In short, the fact-checker network applies the **same behavioral science** that advertising or psy-ops units use â€“ harnessing fear, tribalism, and confirmation bias â€“ to â€œinoculateâ€ society against adversary narratives. The ethical line between education and **social conditioning** is routinely crossed when officials see citizen beliefs as objects of control.

**Integration with Tech Platforms**

The influence of these pseudo-independent fact-checkers is magnified by **formal integration into social media content moderation**. Through programs often euphemistically termed â€œplatform partnershipsâ€ or â€œtrusted flaggerâ€ status, organizations like DFRLab and EUvsDisinfo essentially act as **deputized censors** on Facebook, Twitter, Google/YouTube, and more. Facebookâ€™s partnership with the Atlantic Council since 2018 gave DFRLab privileged access to Facebookâ€™s internal security team and user data for monitoring elections [wired.com](https://www.wired.com/story/facebook-enlists-dfrlab-track-trolls/#:~:text=globe,eager%20to%20establish%20its%20reputation). Leaked emails (via the Twitter Files) revealed that during the 2020 US election, the **DFRLab and Stanford-led â€œElection Integrity Partnershipâ€ (EIP)** had a direct line to Twitter and other tech firms, sending them lists of accounts and posts to censor in real time [c21stleft.com](https://c21stleft.com/2023/10/20/the-westminster-declaration-struggle-for-free-speech-against-censorship/#:~:text=But%20the%20Censorship%20Industrial%20Complex,of%20debate%20and%20intellectual%20inquiry). In one internal Atlantic Council email, DFRLabâ€™s head noted the EIP was _â€œset up at the request of DHS/CISAâ€_ (a US government agency), highlighting how seamlessly government, NGOs, and platforms coordinated behind the scenes [judiciary.house.gov](https://judiciary.house.gov/sites/evo-subsites/republicans-judiciary.house.gov/files/evo-media-document/EIP_Jira-Ticket-Staff-Report-11-7-23-Clean.pdf#:~:text=Finally%2C%20even%20the%20founding%20four,%E2%80%9D98). On the EU side, a **Rapid Alert System** ties Brussels, EU members, the G7, and NATO to a shared communication channel for flagging â€œdisinfoâ€ trend s[eeas.europa.eu](https://www.eeas.europa.eu/eeas/questions-and-answers-about-east-stratcom-task-force_en#:~:text=The%20Rapid%20Alert%20System%20on,Rapid%20Response%20Mechanism%20and%20NATO) [consilium.europa.eu](https://www.consilium.europa.eu/media/44451/200616-progress-report-nr5-eu-nato-eng.pdf#:~:text=Cooperation%20between%20the%20EU%E2%80%99s%20Rapid,The%20Task%20Force). The EU also pressured Big Tech into adopting a **â€œCode of Practice on Disinformationâ€**, now strengthened under the 2022 **Digital Services Act** (DSA) to require platforms to **algorithmically down-rank or remove content** flagged by vetted fact-checkers [techpolicy.press](https://techpolicy.press/eu-disinformation-code-takes-effect-amid-censorship-claims-and-trade-tensions#:~:text=,is%20now%20locked%20into) [c21stleft.com](https://c21stleft.com/2023/10/20/the-westminster-declaration-struggle-for-free-speech-against-censorship/#:~:text=As%20the%20Twitter%20Files%20revealed%2C,these%20unelected%20and%20unaccountable%20entities). In effect, the Silicon Valley gatekeepers have outsourced significant power to this NATO-aligned truth cartel: **if EUvsDisinfo or partner NGOs label a story â€œfalseâ€ or â€œpropaganda,â€ Facebook and Google algorithms promptly bury it**, and accounts that persist in sharing such content risk suspension. This arrangement operates as an _automated enforcement of NATO-approved narratives_ across the internet. Technical tools like Googleâ€™s Jigsaw unit and various AI content filters are likewise informed by the claims of these fact-checkers. The result is a **synergistic machine for narrative control**: governments and NATO-backed centers supply the â€œdisinfoâ€ designations, and tech platforms execute the policing at scale.

**Epistemic and Democratic Implications**

The rise of this â€œcognitive securityâ€ complex poses a **profound challenge to free inquiry and democratic discourse**. By arrogating to themselves the role of **arbiters of truth**, these actors create an epistemic monopoly that is antithetical to the pluralism democracy requires. As philosopher Byung-Chul Han warns, a system that aggressively filters truth on behalf of citizens tends toward a new form of **soft totalitarianism** â€“ an â€œinfocracyâ€ where power shapes reality by controlling knowledge. Indeed, the **Digital Services Actâ€™s institutionalization of NGO fact-checkers as speech regulators** has been critiqued as outsourcing state censorship to private proxies, evading constitutional free speech protections [c21stleft.com](https://c21stleft.com/2023/10/20/the-westminster-declaration-struggle-for-free-speech-against-censorship/#:~:text=As%20the%20Twitter%20Files%20revealed%2C,these%20unelected%20and%20unaccountable%20entities). Critics across the spectrum (from left-wing journalists to libertarian academics) have dubbed this the **â€œCensorship-Industrial Complexâ€**, noting how it _â€œoperates through visibility filtering, labelling, and manipulation of search resultsâ€¦silencing lawful opinions on topics of national importance, with full support of â€˜disinformation expertsâ€™ who have abandoned journalistic valuesâ€_ [c21stleft.com](https://c21stleft.com/2023/10/20/the-westminster-declaration-struggle-for-free-speech-against-censorship/#:~:text=But%20the%20Censorship%20Industrial%20Complex,of%20debate%20and%20intellectual%20inquiry). Senior journalists like John Pilger and Seymour Hersh, who challenged official narratives, found themselves smeared as spreaders of â€œdisinformationâ€ â€“ a warning to peers that dissent has career costs. Whistleblowers have exposed how easily anti-disinformation work morphs into **domestic political censorship**. For example, emails from the UKâ€™s Integrity Initiative (a secret Foreign Office-funded psy-op) showed plans to discredit opposition leader Jeremy Corbyn by using think-tank allies to plant stories, all under the guise of fighting â€œRussian propaganda.â€ Far from safeguarding truth, the apparatus weaponizes â€œTruthâ„¢â€ to bludgeon inconvenient speech. Scholars like Piers Robinson and Tim Hayward (who faced vilification for probing narratives in Syria and Ukraine) argue that the securitization of information since 2015 has eroded academic and press freedoms. Robinson, a former chair in Politics, Society and Political Journalism at the University of Sheffield, tole me [in a recent interview](https://youtu.be/7Skk7KCevxQ) how he became a particular target after helping expose the suppressed OPCW whistleblower testimony on the Douma chemical incident â€” a challenge to a core Western war narrative that mainstream media refused to touch. His career is a case study in how dissenting scholarship is punished: as respected communication theorist studying propaganda, he found himself smeared as â€œpro-Assadâ€ and attacked by main stream media after insisting that empirical evidence, not political pressure, must guide analysis of conflict reporting. His experience exemplifies how the cognitive warfare system doesnâ€™t just police public discourse â€” it disciplines academics themselves, enforcing an ideological conformity that punishes any deviation from approved geopolitical narratives. Meanwhile critical analysis of Western foreign policy or corporate power is reflexively branded â€œpro-Kremlinâ€ or â€œconspiracy theory,â€ cutting off debate [c21stleft.com](https://c21stleft.com/2023/10/20/the-westminster-declaration-struggle-for-free-speech-against-censorship/#:~:text=What%E2%80%99s%20more%2C%20time%20and%20time,our%20best%20defence%20against%20disinformation). Legal minds, too, are alarmed â€“ noting that concepts like â€œmisinformationâ€ and â€œextremist contentâ€ remain so **ill-defined and politicized** that granting government-affiliated bodies the power to censor on these grounds is ripe for abuse [c21stleft.com](https://c21stleft.com/2023/10/20/the-westminster-declaration-struggle-for-free-speech-against-censorship/#:~:text=As%20is%20made%20clear%20by,for%20the%20possibility%20of%20error). The **Westminster Declaration (2023)**, signed by a trans-partisan group of journalists and scholars, declares that _â€œby labelling certain political or scientific positions as â€˜misinformationâ€™ or â€˜malinformation,â€™ our societies risk getting stuck in false paradigmsâ€¦ No one has a monopoly on truth. Truth must be discovered through dialogue and debate â€“ and we cannot discover truth without allowing for the possibility of errorâ€_ [c21stleft.com](https://c21stleft.com/2023/10/20/the-westminster-declaration-struggle-for-free-speech-against-censorship/#:~:text=As%20is%20made%20clear%20by,for%20the%20possibility%20of%20error). In sum, what began as a campaign to counteract foreign influence has metastasized into a **system of epistemic hegemony** wielded by NATO states and Big Tech â€“ a system that polices citizen thinking and penalizes deviation from approved narratives.

**Conclusion**

This investigation underscores that NATOâ€™s so-called fact-checkers are not the neutral guardians of truth they purport to be, but **combat units in a cognitive war** targeting their own domestic populationsâ€™ minds. Their creation was driven not by a groundswell for truth, but by security agendas responding to geopolitical events (Russiaâ€™s info ops, etc.) and a desire to **preemptively shape public perception** in an era of â€œhybrid threats.â€ Under the lofty rhetoric of â€œbuilding resilienceâ€ and â€œprotecting democracy,â€ an apparatus has been built that **weaponizes information and trust**: it **propagates official narratives, delegitimizes dissent, controls online discourse, and cultivates an atmosphere of quasi-inquisition** against heterodox views. The implications are dire. As the Western alliance increasingly conflates _propaganda management with public service_, citizens face an information space wherein truth is not openly debated but **handed down by accredited â€˜expertsâ€™ with state backing**. This _New Inquisition_ may wear the guise of science and objectivity, but it serves a strategic purpose â€“ to consolidate an **epistemic empire** where NATO and its partners decide what is true, what is false, and what people are permitted to think. Such a system might achieve short-term â€œcognitive security,â€ but at the cost of the very democratic values of transparency, accountability, and free thought that it claims to defend. What I have described here calls for urgent public scrutiny of this network and a reassertion that **the cure for disinformation cannot be an elite information monopoly**. In the end, a society that **sacrifices free inquiry for fear of falsehood** risks trading away truth itself.
